Tasks.Tasks: plan text communication strategies
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Identify the purpose and urgency of the message using a priority matrix in Notion.
2. Select appropriate formats (email, memo, text) for different types of messages in Google Docs templates.
3. Define the target recipients for each type of communication using filters in CRM.
4. Schedule strategic communications planning sessions via Discord.
Tasks.ToolTips: Written forms of communication, such as emails, texts, and memos, used within the organization.

Tasks.Tasks: conduct text communications with employees
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Draft messages according to the planned format and urgency in Google Docs.
2. Ensure all communications meet confidentiality standards .
3. Distribute messages through CRM integrated with email and texting tools.
4. Monitor and log communication delivery and receipt in CRM for tracking.
Tasks.ToolTips: Written forms of communication, such as emails, texts, and memos, used within the organization.

Tasks.Tasks: plan voice communication strategies
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Establish the tone and clarity objectives for all oral communications in a Notion checklist.
2. Define expected duration for different types of calls and meetings using Google Calendar.
3. Identify and list participants for each type of communication in CRM.
Tasks.ToolTips: Oral forms of communication, including phone calls, meetings, and voice messages.

Tasks.Tasks: conduct voice communications with employees
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Conduct scheduled calls and meetings using Discord, ensuring adherence to defined tone and clarity.
2. Use a timer to keep voice communications within planned durations.
Tasks.ToolTips: Oral forms of communication, including phone calls, meetings, and voice messages.

Tasks.Tasks: draft employees contracts
Tasks.Parameters: subject, service, responsibility, duration, salary, benefits, training, privacy, termination
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Gather all necessary details about the employment terms using CRM.
2. Use Google Docs to draft the contract, ensuring all parameters (subject, service, responsibilities, etc.) are included and clearly defined.
3. Review the draft for compliance with labor laws in Notion.
4. Secure managerial approval via Zoho Sign.
5. Store the finalized contract securely in Google Drive and distribute copies through email.

3. provide a contrast checking tool within the design system for ongoing use by designers.
4. document color specifications and contrast standards in the style guide.
5. update training for designers and developers on best practices for maintaining color contrast accessibility.
Tasks.Tools: automated tools, manual testing, chat gpt

Tasks.Tools: html, css, javascript, cookies or local storage, chat gptg

1. design media queries that target various screen sizes and orientations to ensure optimal display and functionality.
2. integrate these media queries into the css framework of the application to maintain design consistency.
3. test the media queries across a range of devices to confirm they correctly adjust the layout and functionality based on device characteristics.
4. optimize the css for performance to prevent any delays in rendering on mobile devices.
5. document the media query strategy, including breakpoints used and css code examples for future reference.

Tasks.Tasks: test and optimize touch interactions and gestures for mobile devices
Tasks.Checklists:
1. develop interactive elements optimized for touch, such as buttons, sliders, and swipe actions.
2. test these interactions on various touch-enabled devices to assess responsiveness and ease of use.
3. adjust touch sensitivity and interaction design based on user feedback and usability testing results.
4. ensure compatibility with different browsers and mobile operating systems to prevent functionality issues.
5. document the implementation of touch interactions, including guidelines for designing touch-friendly ui components.

Tasks.Tasks: create graceful degradation strategies for older browsers that lack modern functionality
Tasks.Checklists:
1. identify key functionalities that may not be supported by older browsers.
2. design alternative implementations that allow the application to function acceptably on these older versions.
3. implement these fallback options using techniques like conditional loading and feature detection.
4. test the application on older browsers to ensure that core functionalities are accessible.
5. document the graceful degradation strategy, detailing how the application handles browser incompatibilities.

Tasks.Tasks: implement progressive enhancement techniques to provide a basic level of user experience in older browsers
Tasks.Checklists:
1. build the application's core functionality first, using technologies that are widely supported in older browsers.
2. add advanced features that enhance the experience but are not critical for basic functionality, ensuring they do not hinder access on older devices.
3. use feature detection to conditionally load enhanced features only when the browser supports them.
4. routinely test the applications progressive enhancement strategy across different browser versions.
5. document the approach and specific techniques used for progressive enhancement, including code samples and browser compatibility charts.

Tasks.Tasks: develop a routine testing protocol for new features on legacy systems
Tasks.Checklists:
1. establish a testing protocol that includes regular checks on older browsers and devices.
2. integrate automated testing tools that simulate older environments to ensure new features do not break existing functionalities.
3. engage a subset of the user base that uses legacy systems for beta testing of new features.
4. adjust feature designs based on the testing feedback to ensure compatibility and performance on older systems.
5. document the testing procedures, tools used, and feedback integration processes to maintain a consistent approach to legacy support.

2. integrate the toggle mechanism into the applications backend to control feature availability dynamically.
3. test the feature toggles to ensure they correctly enable or disable features without affecting other application parts.
4. document how to implement and manage feature toggles, including guidelines on deciding when and how to use them.

Tasks.Parameters: candidate, status, date, call, introduction, portfolio
Tasks.Checklists:
1. Review candidate profiles and video introductions available on your website, selecting potential candidates based on CVs and skill tags.
2. Send CVs and links to candidate profiles to the potential client for preliminary selection.
3. Once selections are made, contact the client via Google Calendar to discuss and confirm a convenient time for the interview.
4. After agreeing on the time, send the Google Meet link for the interview to candidates via Discord and schedule the meeting in Google Calendar for the client.
5. Confirm all interview details with candidates and the client a day before the interview via Discord and Google Calendar reminders.
6. Ensure all participants have access to the necessary information and that the Google Meet environment is set up correctly and functioning prior to the interview.

3. Send a detailed email via Gmail to all participants with the Google Meet link and a brief overview of the call's agenda, primarily focusing on the client explaining the project details and candidate roles.
4. Confirm the call setup a day before using Google Calendar reminders, ensuring all participants are prepared.
Tasks.Tools: Google Calendar, Gmail, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, Skype
